intro: Camassia biflora, commonly known as the western camas, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands and meadows. Its bulbs are edible when fully mature and have been used by indigenous peoples for food. Camassia biflora plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
